name: Historic Anchorage Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please see my pictures below. I'm giving this hotel 4 stars because this was fun place to stay. Also, the staff are so helpful and positive. There are a lot of restaurants and shops within walking distance. The room we had was like a mini-suite and was on the top floor. I would recommend booking a room on the top floor because the hotel is old and the floors are kind of creaky. If you get a room on one of the bottom floors you might hear the sounds of the people above you. The hotel was overall a good value and had a waffle and fruit breakfast included in the room price.
reviews.title: Cute and fun place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have done a nice job renovating this hotel. Breakfast is served in the bar area which has an old time feel to it. The breakfast was great with cereal, bagels and fresh waffles with fruit. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. I've stayed at hotels that cost a lot more and had more stars and they didn't come close to the personal service Historic Anchorage hotel had. It is right across the street from the downtown market which is a really neat thing to see.
reviews.title: Great service, location and history!

likes.disliked: — Bathroom was a little small for my personal liking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we go back to Anchorage we plan on staying here again.
reviews.title: Very "Quaint" Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband discovered this hotel on the internet and thought that it sounded like just the place that we needed for our stay in Anchorage. We were there celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary for a few days and then on to Denali and then returning back to Anchorage for a one night's stay before our flight home. I can't say enough about the staff at the hotel. They were so very helpful and nice in accommodating our needs due to our luggage not arriving for 3 days and also making our dinner celebration reservations very memorable. The hotel was very clean and very centrally located for all of our needs. The weekend market is just steps away and the train depot is very nearby. You can walk to so many locations which makes it alot easier due to difficult car parking situations. The only negatives that I found are the rooms are not air conditioned but there is a fan and I would recommend that you request a room away from the main street due to being very noisy all hours of the day and night. The breakfast included things like yogurt, fruit, cereal to homemade waffles. Great coffee! We highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a small hometown atmosphere as opposed to a larger accommodation.
reviews.title: Nice stay, but a few issues

likes.liked: — Excellent room for what we paid!
likes.disliked: — painfully slow wi-fi made working away from home impossible at the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is quaint. Old and historic (as the name says) but renovated quite nicely. Great location downtown. Right on the corner of 4th Street, very close to many of the bars and clubs in the party district. Our room was very clean. Bed was firm and not uncomfortable. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. The free breakfast was nice, with cereals, fruits, yogurts and really cool make-your-own waffle machines! Although the coffee was Seattle's Best, we didn't care for any of the roasts that were available. The free wi-fi was excruciatingly slow during our entire visit, making it impossible to send or receive email from our laptops (both Mac and Windows). Room with a view means room facing the street, which can be problematic and loud on weekends when the nearby bars empty out late at night. While we found a few problems with our experience there, they were nothing that wouldn't keep us from coming back. Next time, we're asking for a room in the back of the hotel, away from the street.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and sunny. My only complaint is that there were many drunkards on the street late at night and they were loud. I can't blame the hotel for that though.
reviews.title: Clean, cute, great location!
Aspen Hotel has an outstanding staff
reviews.text: A pleasant experience. Rooms were clean and spacious. The staff very helpful and Shuttle service to the Railroad and Airport was prompt.

reviews.title: not the fanciest, but a decent place to stay
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was a plus. Its a great place to make your home base when traveling to Alaska.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Wonderful Stay
reviews.text: They definitely tried hard, but the stay just wasn't quite there...The place is not all that bad, but it could use a bit of an update, and a little better cleaning in the bathroom. Its a pretty old hotel, set up like hotels were configured during mining days, but its been renovated within the last decade or so. The rooms are large, but the breakfast is lame.Wireless does not work, but that's not surprising. Next time, I'll try the Inlet Towers.

reviews.title: True elegance and service in downtown Anchorage
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed at the Anchorage Hotel for our Honeymoon, and our stay was definately first rate. The location itself could sell the hotel, right in the middle of everything downtown. The attentive staff, beautifully furnished rooms, and free morning breakfast were all exceptional. Don't be fooled by this historic boutique hotel either, they offer state of the art business services too. High speed wireless internet, digital television with pay movies, copies, faxes, etc. Would highly recommend, I know that we will stay here again our next visit to Anchorage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: Let me start with saying that the hotel is Ok nothing great. All the comments you may read about the, " Super great breakfast" are well strange, the breakfast is nice but it is nothing that you would not get at any Hotel the likes of a Comfort inn, or Holiday inn. Bottom line you get your basic free breakfast. The staffs are however very nice and should be complimented along with the location, you can't get a better location for the downtown area. Rooms at the hotel are very very very small ( that's three very's) (about 7 feet by 10 feet total living area) My main discontent with the hotel is that lack of transportation from the airport. THEY HAVE NO SHUTTLE SERVICE. A cab will cost about 21.00-25.00 dollars. Bottom line the hotel is over priced, for not having the above, For the one day I spent in the Anchorage I would/should have stayed elsewhere. On a different note: One night/two days in Anchorage is more then enough. Get out into the great outdoors as soon as you can, for Alaska is truly an UNREAL place.
reviews.title: OK PLACE BUT THAT'S ABOUT IT
Paid reservation was not honored
reviews.text: When we arrived tired from travel, schlepping our luggage on foot, they informed us a tour group had extended their stay and there would be no rooms for my husband and me, nor for my elderly mother who was with us. I thought a reservation meant that they would hold the rooms, especially since we had paid in full in advance. They didn't refund our money, simply booked us into another hotel of a lower quality, and I'm sure the Historic Anchorage Hotel made a profit on the difference, as well as charging the tour group higher rates than what I paid through my travel agent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: The reservation document goes into detail about the cancellation penalty, but what about the penalty for a hotel that doesn't hold up its end of the bargain?
reviews.title: a nice, convenient place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: You should know there's no air conditioning, so in summer rooms can get hot. But it's very convenient, the rooms are a good size and the service people try very hard. I'd stay there again.
reviews.title: nice and convenient
My favorite downtown hotel
reviews.text: It's a nice little place but you should know there's no air conditioning so in summer it can get quite hot. But it's very, very convenient and the rooms are a decent size. The service people try very hard (even though some didn't know the outlying area, they'd find out for you). I'd stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Amazing little hotel in Downtown Anchorage, close to all the shops and the 5th Avenue Mall.
reviews.title: Great hotel in an ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Great stay, nice breakfast (philadelphia spread cheese on a hot bagel etc.), very friendly staff.
reviews.title: Great location near bus and train connections

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Free wifi too. Spacious rooms, cable TV etc.
reviews.title: right downtown!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Best hotel in Anchorage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel because of its high percentage of 4 and 5 ratings and because I needed a hotel close to the Park Connection bus pick up at the Egan Center on 5th Avenue between E and F Streets.
reviews.title: READ THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS- I DIDN'T AND NOW WISH THAT I WOULD HAVE
Very Nice, Clean and Convenient with Good Service
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for two nights in early August. The room was spacious and clean. The employees were very friendly, courteous and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was perfect for our family of four. Because we were in Anchorage during particularly warm weather, our room was hot during the day. Thank heavens for the fan. We had to leave the windows open at night to help cool the room down. Unfortunately, the Hilton Hotel bar entrance and, more importantly, exit were right next door. We heard traffic and people until about midnight. From 2 to 3 am we heard very loud bar patrons lesiurely leaving the area. I wish we had heeded another writers comment regarding rooms away from the main street. All in all, we would stay here again--just in a room without a view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: Stayed at the Anchorage Hotel on April 18-19 after abandoning our reservation at the Sherton due to poor service. While this property isn't going to win any awards for decor or amenities, we found our room both cozy and clean and the hotel ideally located. Also enjoyed the historic photographs hung throughout the hotel. We had a corner room which, while bright and breezy during the day, was also fairly loud at night due to the foot traffic (often of the inebriated variety) on the street two floors below. We had a standard room with a comfortable king bed and paid just $79/night -- a great value considering the Sheraton reservation we'd canceled was $149/night. We were at the farthest end of the hotel from the lobby so while it offered free wireless, our connection was spotty at best although we were able to get online thanks to the wi-fi offered by the restaurant across the street. We stayed two nights and interacted with quite a few of the staff (albeit briefly) -- everyone was perfectly pleasant including the maid service. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Charming, affordable alternative to chains
Good hotel, good location
reviews.text: Just got back from a four-night stay at the Historic Anchorage Hotel and am surprised that the hotel isn't ranked on the hotel listings. We found the room to be generous in size and the location was great - close to the train station, the Sunday market and near shopping and dining options. They have a continental breakfast each morning with make-your-own waffles, and other breakfast items (the only egg option was a hard-boiled one, but it was good!) I would recommend the hotel for any traveler.

reviews.title: Great hotel!
reviews.text: I stayed here for 6 nights and was delighted with the hotel. I'm a journalist and travel a lot so it takes a lot to make me want to write a reveiw. For me, the Historic Anchorage Hotel deserves kudos. My room was nicely decorated and clean. The people at the front desk were awesome! Helpful as they could be. The free continental breakfast was solid - hot and cold cerals, yogurt, fresh fruit, bagels, waffles, etc. And the location is ideal for downtown Anchorage.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2004
reviews.text: Daylle Deanna Schwartz
reviews.title: Quaint Affordability

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We finished up our cruise and wanted a nice cozy place to stay. According to the reviews we thought the Historic Anchorage Hotel would fill the bill and did it ever! We arrived very early and Lorna the desk clerk was all too happy to store our bags so we could head out to see the sites. Her restaurant recommendations were excellent. When we returned, our bags were already in our room. When we got up to the room we found that it was perfect! There was lots of room, it was very clean, and thoroughly modern. We wouldn't have changed a thing. The staff was always happy to help and always very pleasant. This was the perfect end to a perfect trip.
reviews.title: Wanted something different; what a great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We enjoyed our night at this hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and our room was comfy and quiet. We particularly enjoyed the breakfast in the old bar downstairs (not used as a bar now). It was a beautiful room and full of local historical tidbits -- not to mention articles about resident ghosts at the hotel! My son loved it. I should also mention that the breakfast was phenomenal -- so many choices and all delicious. I should also mention that this hotel is affiliated with a good gift shop (and offers a 10% discount) for those last-minute souvenirs!
reviews.title: Neat hotel full of local history

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to stay in a hotel that could be anywhere, there are plenty of anonymous looking chains in Anchorage. If you want to know you're in Anchorage, get a room here and the tilted floors will remind you that the hotel survived the 1964 earthquake. Lovely lobby and breakfast room (which is alas, no longer a bar at night). Luxury lovers, this isn't for you.... there is no AC, and a lot of the furniture has seen better days. Our bed was comfortable, though. As other posters have mentioned, perhaps the hotel's best feature is the staff. They were terrifically warm and friendly and responded with great kindness when my husband suffered an injury, cutting our vacation short-- we were allowed to stay till 5 PM so we would not have to sit around the airport all day. Thank you Terry, Kelly and everyone for your help!
reviews.title: Warm service in funky old hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the Historic Anchorage was very helpful and accomodating. The room was lovely and comfortable. We had room 201 which was at the front corner of the hotel. It was bright with windows on two walls but was a bit noisy (we were warned of this by the front desk). Although there are reports of ghosts in this hotel, we were not visited by any ghosts.
reviews.title: Historic hotel in an interesting part of Anchorage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Historic Anchorage is a great old hotel in the "trendy" area of Anchorage. It's close to a lot of great restaurants & galleries. What made the stay great was the staff. We stayed here after a 10 days of being very active so by the time we go here we were pretty spent. The staff made suggestions on where to eat, made the reservations, our tranportation arrangements back to the airport...the were great. I have stayed at the Sheraton in Anchorage as well & I would recommend the Historic Anchorage Hotel over them.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nicely updated historic hotel in downtown Anchorage. We chose it because it was walking distance to the train station. If you enjoy staying in historic hotels, you will enjoy the rooms but be aware that the hotel is located downtown and there are several clubs in the area that are open until 2:30am. Also, it is located at a busy intersection which makes it a convenient location but also means there is more traffic. There is no air conditioning so you can't close the windows completely but there was a large fan in the room. The staff was very nice.
reviews.title: Nice but noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely lovely. An antidote to those big hotels. stayed 2 nights when arrived in Alaska. first 2 nights had a good, spacious room - last night put us in "the laurence suite," where wonderful legendary Alaskan landscape artist Sydney Laurence used to stay when in Anchorage. Fantastically friendly and helpful staff. Complimentary breakfast buffet just fine. It is in the centre of Anchorage so noisy Friday/Saturday nights (part of the ambience). the rooms are very hot and need to sleep with fan going. Fun souvenir shop next door - Grizzly Gifts - which is very reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Wonderful, characterful hotel in central downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: If you have a car eat at the Flying Machine Restaurant in the Millenium Hotel Anchorage. The restaurant is situated right on lake hood. food is fantastic.
reviews.title: PERFECT FOR TWO SISTERS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is centrally located in downtown Anchorage. Perfect for walking everywhere.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL STAFF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Quaint and comfortable hotel and the service and staff (especially Terri, the manager at front desk) make this my hotel of choice in Anchorage. The delicious breakfast that is complimentary is more like a full breakfast. If you are looking for great food try Glacier Brewhouse or Simon and Seafort's.
reviews.title: Unparalleled customer service!!!!
Tiny Room, Noisy Location
reviews.text: I stayed at the Anchorage Hotel for 5 nights and I would not repeat the experience. First, the plus: it was in a very convenient location and I could easily walk to all the places I needed (and wanted) to go. Next, the negatives: The room was very tiny, it barely fit the bed and entertainment cabinet and there was no floor space to speak of. There was no air conditioning, just an old floor-standing fan which was very loud when I turned it on. Finally, and probably the worst part, my room was next to the street and even though I was there midweek there were very loud drunk people who would talk under my window at all hours of the night, every night. If going to Anchorage, I would strongly recommend the Dimond Center Hotel if you have rented a car.

reviews.title: Loved the location
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for part of our 25th Anniversary trip to Alaska. The hotel was near everything we wanted to see. It's close to the Saturday Market, all the gift shops, the mall, The Alaskan Railroad station and it was within walking distance to the coastal trail and the information center and walking tour. I will definately stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Historic Anchorage Hotel in July this year and found the hotel to be perfectly positioned to see all of Anchorage. The breakfast room, which was the bar, is lovely with old wood and a beautiful bar and a stuffed polar bear! The breakfast was more than adequate, although served on paper plates, you can help yourself to whatever you fancy and make your own waffles fresh. We had a room on the 2nd floor at the front of the hotel. There was some noise from Rum Runners across the road but it was not exceptional and we were able to sleep. The rooms are very big and I was very impressed with the size and the number of windows which made the room very bright and the views impressive. The staff were very friendly and I woudl definately go back!
reviews.title: Fantastic Historic Hotel, right in the middle of Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: This nice historic hotel is extremely convenient to town and all it's great places to eat. The front desk staff; Terri, Jessica, and Magda were all very kind and helpful. The room price was reasonable. The room was very neat and clean. Breakfast was tasty and done well. In summation I'd say the stay here was a blessings to us!
reviews.title: premium place to stay and caring staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel during the Halloween event, with local paranormal investigators from IOPIA, Oct. 30th 2010. This was a fantastic time, we actually witnessed paranormal occurances while investigating room 215 with the team!
reviews.title: This is a fantastic place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So much history, beautiful art, great location, good food, super clean, friendly staff. I will be booking a room for next year's investigation event!
reviews.title: Great hotel and staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 weeks in the Historic for the second time in September 2010 having been there in 2008. The hotel had still the same friendly atmosphere, cleanliness was 100%, location was good as it was near lots of attractions and transport to other locations could always be found.
reviews.title: BE WARNED!

description: Elegantly restored and generously appointed, the Anchorage Hotel is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. Rich in tradition and elegance... Conveniently located in the heart of downtown Anchorage. The Anchorage Visitor Information Center, Anchorage Convention Centers, 5th Avenue Shopping Mall, the Alaska Center for Performing Arts, the Alaska Railroad Depot, Anchorage Museum, and some of the finest dining and entertainment that Anchorage has to offer are all just steps away from the hotel.Aside from our convenient room amenities, Anchorage Historic Hotel offers guest services to accommodate everyone from the discerning leisure traveler to the busy corporate guest.
